snippet: Five C.I.A. commandos write that a C.I.A. base chief stopped them from interceding in time to save the life of Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens during the attack on the diplomatic mission in 2012.
abstract: Five Central Intelligence Agency commandos who were guarding CIA base in Benghazi, Libya, in Sept 2012 allege in new book 13 Hours that their station chief stopped them from interceding in time to save lives of Ambassador J Christopher Stevens and a technician during the attack on the American diplomatic mission there; book opens a new front in fierce political battle over who is at fault for the American deaths.
lead_paragraph: Five C.I.A. commandos write that a C.I.A. base chief stopped them from interceding in time to save the life of Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens during the attack on the diplomatic mission in 2012.

headline.main: New Book Says C.I.A. Official in Benghazi Held Up Rescue
headline.print_headline: New Book Says C.I.A. Official in Benghazi Held Up Rescue

keywords.value: 13 Hours: The Inside Account of What Really Happened In Benghazi (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works
